Not much to say about recent work, but I’d like to share a lecture I wrote for the honors section of the systems programming course I am helping teach. It’s a broad overview on stack buffer overflow exploits and common defenses, for the newbie systems programmer, with a few pretty diagrams that I spent way too much time on…

(Apologies about the PDF viewer if it’s not looking quite right. You can view the slides directly.)
